posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The biggest challenge if you want to build BG henchmen for NWN is to translate the AD&D 2nd edition builds to D&D 3rd edition rules, (or the bioware interpretation of the D&D 3rd edition).
In BG you rolled your stats (con, dex, wis etc), roughly as a 3d6 roll for every stat with some modifications based on class and race. In NWN you buy stats with a fixed number of buy points available and get further stat increases with levelling. What exactly the stats do for the character differs greatly between the 2nd and 3rd edition rules. AB, saves, skills, proficiencies and feats were also totally reworked with the 3rd edition, and so were also the rules for multiclassing.
If you want to build a Minsc copy for NWN, you must try to figure what the essence of the character is and try to recreate that according to the 3rd ed rules. Basicly that is a very strong warrior type human, not that bright and offering one and only one standard solution to every problem (high str, low int and wis). I would multiclass him with barbarian for his attitude and rage and ranger for a pet (sorry, but no hamsters companions in vanilla NWN) and for FE (vs gnolls wasn't it) and stealth skill etc.

posts.author: Mithril Jack
posts.content:
Max, I realize that you are probably going for a power gaming version of Minsc, but I think the following 3 changes would bring about a closer approximation of him.


1) I could be wrong, but in the BG series wasn't Minsc's WIS subpar for a Ranger? If so then start him off as a 1st level Barbarian, knock his WIS down to 10, and bump his CON up to 16.

2) IIRC Minsc preferred swords over halberds ("my sword doesn't work, I need a bigger sword").

3) According to Minsc, Boo was a "miniature giant space hamster". A case could be made for making Boo a dire rat. At least hamsters and rats are both rodents. In BGII there was a possible scenario where Jan Jansen steals Boo. I believe it's a bit easier to steal a dire rat than a bear.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mithril Jack wrote:Max, I realize that you are probably going for a power gaming version of Minsc, but I think the following 3 changes would bring about a closer approximation of him.


1) I could be wrong, but in the BG series wasn't Minsc's WIS subpar for a Ranger? If so then start him off as a 1st level Barbarian, knock his WIS down to 10, and bump his CON up to 16.

2) IIRC Minsc preferred swords over halberds ("my sword doesn't work, I need a bigger sword").

3) According to Minsc, Boo was a "miniature giant space hamster". A case could be made for making Boo a dire rat. At least hamsters and rats are both rodents. In BGII there was a possible scenario where Jan Jansen steals Boo. I believe it's a bit easier to steal a dire rat than a bear.
I understand your comments, and they are absolutely spot on from a RP angle of things. The problem is that in all these games, they don't build well for the henchmen / party members. My aim when doing this was to powerbuild as much as I could to sort of "make due" to these great characters with strong builds that would still match their stories. Going WIS 10 would make him weaker while adding little RP value. You'd make him unable to cast spells without changing virtually anything else. But on the other hand, those points could go to Constitution and make him tougher, so that's a valid point. Starting with Barbarian isn't, however, as that would mean only one Taunt dump at lvl 39, so that's why I chose to keep things that way.

As for the Companion, all you have to do is change the companion to Dire Rat if you want. Unfortunately, they are REALLY BAD and would die constantly in Neverwinter Nights, so what you'd manage with this alteration is to have Boo be unsummoned most of the time in-game, which is why I chose the bear. At least you'd be able to see Boo in-game for more than three seconds :>D

Finally the weapon: this is pretty much anyone's choice. You can change the weapon to Greatsword if you want. I used to equip him with a two-handed sword IIRC, but Valerfor, who's helping me with this, told me to make him a Halberd user, and he's played the game much more than I , so I followed his lead.

Thanks for the feedback.
